body:
JSTypedLowering::ReduceJSEqual / ReduceJSStrictEqual folding of x == null/undefined to ObjectIsUndetectable

Symbols:
- JSTypedLowering::ReduceJSEqual
- JSTypedLowering::ReduceJSStrictEqual
- simplified()->ObjectIsUndetectable()

Files/paths:
- src/compiler/js-typed-lowering.cc (JSTypedLowering::ReduceJSEqual, ReduceJSStrictEqual)

Summary of relevant code behavior:
- ReduceJSEqual detects the case where one input is NullOrUndefined (OneInputIs(Type::NullOrUndefined())). It relaxes effects/controls, removes the null/undefined input, changes the operator to simplified()->ObjectIsUndetectable() and returns that node. This folds abstract equality `x == null/undefined` into an undetectable check (ObjectIsUndetectable(right) or ObjectIsUndetectable(left)).
- ReduceJSStrictEqual delegates to ReduceJSEqual for non-strict fallback where applicable.

Why important: This is the TurboFan-level folding that turns abstract equality against null/undefined into the ObjectIsUndetectable simplified op, which later must be lowered and may attach a protector dependency to ensure validity of assuming undetectable objects don't exist.
explanation: Contains the lowering that replaces equality-with-null/undefined with ObjectIsUndetectable (key turbo fan folding).
